dt.t: The {wi}watershed{/wi} of the Himalayas does not lie along the line of its highest peaks, as in most mountain ranges, but about a hundred miles farther north.

dt: {bc}a region or area bounded peripherally by a divide and draining ultimately to a particular watercourse or body of water
{bc}a crucial dividing point, line, or factor {bc}{sx|turning point||}

dt.t: This year marked a {wi}watershed{/wi} for contemporary classical music in the city.
The spring of 1949 was, in general, a {wi}watershed{/wi} in Joe Liebling's life.
The death of Ugandan teacher Gregory Byaruhanga at the hands of the Kenyan police has marked a {wi}watershed{/wi} in the rising tension in the region and in the instability of the Kenyan regime.

The {wi}watershed{/wi} year for science fiction must be 1968, when Stanley Kubrick's {it}2001: A Space Odyssey{/it} appeared, not only dramatically expanding for this kind of motion picture the potentials of film technology, but making science fiction a vehicle for both poetic vision and metaphysical exploration.

dt: {bc}the time of day after which television programs not appropriate for children may be broadcast

{bc}an area of tissue (as of the brain or colon) that is located at the periphery of two separate arterial systems, is dependent on both for blood supply, and may be poorly perfused and vulnerable to {d_link|ischemia|ischemia}

dt.t: Brain imaging of patients with vascular dementia typically show small strokes or poor blood supply deep in the brain, at the natural terminal (the so-called {wi}watershed{/wi} area) of the blood vessel.
… cell death caused by blocked blood flow in the brain's {ldquo}{wi}watershed{/wi}{rdquo} region, where two arteries supply blood.

shortdef: a dividing ridge between drainage areas : divide
a region or area bounded peripherally by a divide and draining ultimately to a particular watercourse or body of water
a crucial dividing point, line, or factor : turning point — often used before another noun

dt: {bc}a localized area of {d_link|ischemic|ischemia} tissue death in an area of the brain situated at the farthest point of blood supply from two separate cerebral arterial systems that is caused by inadequate blood flow (as from low blood pressure, vasculitis, or blood clot obstruction)
{bc}a stroke resulting from such ischemic tissue death

shortdef: a localized area of ischemic tissue death in an area of the brain situated at the farthest point of blood supply from two separate cerebral arterial systems that is caused by inadequate blood flow (as from low blood pressure, vasculitis, or blood clot obstruction)
a stroke resulting from such ischemic tissue death
